IndexPage.title: Code for Taiwan
IndexPage.subtitle: Learn Programming Thinking Together
IndexPage.description: We are a civic tech community, developing programming thinking together and creating change through technology

hero.headline: Learn Programming Thinking Together
hero.subheadline: Monthly online meetups on the third Wednesday - Share experience and learn from each other

about.title: Where We Build Programming Thinking
about.subtitle: AI tools made development easier, but many people are like playing slot machines - press buttons and it works, without knowing why. We meet monthly to discuss code concepts, share experience, and develop thinking together

message_card.user_message: I can use tools to build things, but want to understand the principles...

open_source.title: Concepts Over Tools
open_source.description: Discuss why we code this way, not just how to code

community_driven.title: Open & Friendly
community_driven.description: No matter what tools you use or your background, you're welcome to share

innovation.title: Learn from Experience
innovation.description: Hear about others' mistakes, share your own solutions

questions.question: What is Code for Taiwan?
questions.answer: Code for Taiwan is a civic tech community that develops programming thinking and shares development experience through monthly meetups. We bring together engineers, designers, PMs, and people interested in technology to learn together, discuss code concepts, and grow together

questions.question: I don't have a technical background, can I participate?
questions.answer: Of course! We welcome people from all backgrounds to our meetups. Listening to how others think about problems and solve them, you'll learn a lot. Everyone can improve themselves by learning programming thinking

questions.question: How do I start learning programming thinking?
questions.answer: Join our monthly online meetups, chat on Discord, or come directly to meetups and meet everyone. Through monthly third Wednesday discussions and exchanges, we develop programming thinking together

questions.question: Are Code for Taiwan's learning resources free?
questions.answer: Yes, our monthly online meetups are free to attend, and discussions and experience sharing are open to everyone. We believe knowledge sharing is key to community growth

questions.question: How do I contact the Code for Taiwan team?
questions.answer: Through our official website, Discord community, or by directly attending our monthly online meetups on the third Wednesday. Feel free to join our online community and exchange ideas with other participants

events.title: Monthly Online Meetups on the Third Wednesday
events.subtitle: Discuss code concepts and share development experience

join.title: Community
join.subtitle: Join our

roles.developers_description: Share development experience, discuss thinking behind different frameworks and tools
roles.designers_description: Understand code concepts to collaborate better with engineers
roles.data_scientists_description: Exchange ideas about data processing and best practices
roles.project_managers_description: Understand the thinking process behind technical decisions
roles.community_organizers_description: Help spread the word about our meetups
